action.primary: Expels Wind-Cold and unblocks the nasal passages

indications: Nasal obstruction or congestion, pain, discharge, lack of smell sinus problems and related headache due to Wind-Cold
With appropriate herbs for any nasal or sinus condition

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with Yin Deficiency with Heat signs.
Contraindicated for those with Liver Yang Rising.
Contraindicated for those with nasal congestion due to Wind-Cold invasion who are Qi Deficient.
Contraindicated for those with headache from Blood Deficiency with accumulated Fire.
Contraindicated for those with toothache from Stomach Fire.
Overdose may cause dizziness or red eyes.
incompatibilities: Incompatible with Rz. Acori Tatarinowii #{ShiChangPu} Shi Chang Pu.

useCases: Improves the efficacy of Xin Yi.
Strongly unblocks nasal obstruction and sinus headache due to Wind-Cold or Wind-Heat for sinusitis and rhinitis with loss of sense of smell.
Wind-Cold nasal obstruction and sinus headache with greater effect.
Lifts and spreads the clear Qi while unblocking the nasal orifices to treat headache and sinus distention, nasal congestion and thick nasal discharge due to Wind-Cold.
Wind-Cold Attacking the Lungs and Stomach with continuous, clear, watery nasal discharge.
Sinusitis or rhinitis due to Cold.
Chronic sinusitis or rhinitis due to Damp-Heat.
Sinusitis or rhinitis due to Heat.
Sinusitis or rhinitis with Lung Heat.

notes: This is the primary herb for treating sinus problems.
It is the furry unopened flower bud.
It is usually combined with Pueraria #{GeGen} Ge Gen and other Wind expelling herbs.
The essential oil can be inhaled for quick relief of sinus congestion.
This herb has a quite strong anti-fungal action on the skin and can be used as a facial cream for chloasma.
Daoists say this herb adds years to one's life span.
Dry-fried Magnolia Flower Chao Xin Yi has the hairs which irritate the throat removed.
